content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
──────────────────
### Copper Cable Factory at Position(x=2.5, y=17.5)
Consists of the factory’s input and processing components:
– Factory burner inserter retrieved at Position(x=2.5, y=16.5)
– Dedicated factory burner inserter placed using direction RIGHT at Position(x=3.5, y=17.5)
– Cable factory input chest at Position(x=2.5, y=17.5)
– Assembling machine (copper-cable production) at Position(x=1.5, y=19.5)

### Extraction Depot System at Position(x=3.5, y=15.5)
This chain is intended to channel extracted items toward processing:
– Extraction system burner inserter (source) at Position(x=-3.5, y=27.5) with drop at Position(x=-3.5, y=28.5)
– Depot wooden chest serving as an isolated belt depot at Position(x=3.5, y=15.5)
– Dedicated transport belt segment adjacent to the depot chest at Position(x=4.5, y=15.5)
– Depot burner inserter placed using direction UP at Position(x=3.5, y=14.5) with pickup at Position(x=3.5, y=15.5) and drop at Position(x=3.5, y=13.5)

### Electricity Generator at Position(x=-0.5, y=24.5)
This setup is designed for electrical power generation:
– Steam engine (generator) at Position(x=-0.5, y=24.5)
– Boiler at Position(x=-5.5, y=24.0)
– Offshore pump at Position(x=-7.5, y=25.5)

ERROR TIPS
──────────
• Transport Belt Connection Errors  
  – When attempting belt connections, the target was repeatedly misidentified as a steam engine. Always ensure that transport belts are connected to an inserter that can accept items rather than directly to a Prototype.SteamEngine.

• Placement Distance Error  
  – Placing a wooden chest failed when the target position (e.g. Position(x=3.5, y=15.5)) was too far from the player’s current position. Before placement, move close enough to the target tile so that placement falls within the allowed maximum distance.

• Undefined Variable Errors  
  – An error was raised due to use of an undefined variable (e.g. 'target_chest'). Verify variable names and ensure that all target entities are correctly defined before use.
